[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Struct: CoinInfoResource] [Supply manipulation] Can attackers exploit the OptionalAggregatorV1Resource supply field to manipulate total supply tracking and mint unlimited coins? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Function: symbol()] [UTF-8 exploit] Does symbol() properly handle invalid UTF-8 in the symbol Vec<u8>, or can attackers inject malicious byte sequences that cause parsing vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Function: supply_aggregator_state_key()] [Unwrap panic] Does supply_aggregator_state_key() safely handle None values with unwrap() calls, or can attackers cause validator panics by creating CoinInfo with None supply? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Function: random()] [Weak randomness] Does random() use cryptographically secure randomness for handle and key generation, or can attackers predict aggregator addresses and precompute collisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Function: new()] [Parameter validation] Does new() validate that limit is reasonable, or can attackers create coins with u128::MAX limits that effectively disable supply caps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Function: to_writeset()] [State consistency] Can to_writeset() create inconsistent state where CoinInfo and aggregator value are out of sync, allowing supply manipulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Field: decimals] [Decimal overflow] Can attackers create coins with excessive decimal values (e.g., decimals=255) to cause integer overflow in balance calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Generic: CoinType] [Type parameter exploit] Can attackers abuse the generic CoinType parameter to create type confusion between different coin types and steal funds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_info.rs] [Function: to_writeset()] [WriteOp security] Does to_writeset() use legacy_modification which might bypass versioning checks, allowing attackers to overwrite protected state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Struct: CoinStoreResource] [Frozen bypass] Can attackers bypass the frozen flag check to withdraw coins from frozen accounts through race conditions or state manipulation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: set_coin()] [Direct manipulation] Does set_coin() allow direct balance manipulation without proper access control, enabling attackers to arbitrarily set their balances? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Field: coin] [Integer overflow] Can coin balance (u64) overflow in deposit operations, wrapping to small values and causing fund loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: withdraw_events_mut()] [Event manipulation] Can attackers manipulate event handles through mutable references to emit false events and confuse external systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Generic: CoinType] [Type confusion] Can attackers exploit PhantomData<C> to confuse different coin types and exchange low-value coins for high-value ones? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Struct: CoinStoreResourceUntyped] [Type safety bypass] Does CoinStoreResourceUntyped allow bypassing type safety checks to manipulate coins without type validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Function: frozen()] [TOCTOU] Is there a time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerability between checking frozen() and executing withdrawals? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/coin_store.rs] [Field: deposit_events] [Event ordering] Can event handle sequence numbers be manipulated to reorder or duplicate deposit events for double-counting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collection.rs] [Struct: CollectionResource] [Creator forgery] Can attackers forge the creator field to claim ownership of collections they didn't create? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collection.rs] [Field: description] [String injection] Can attackers inject malicious content in description/name/uri strings to exploit parsers or UI components? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collection.rs] [Field: mutation_events] [Event injection] Can attackers emit fake mutation events to make it appear that collection metadata was changed by legitimate parties? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collection.rs] [Function: new()] [Immutability bypass] Does new() create immutable collections, or can attackers modify creator/metadata after creation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collections.rs] [Struct: CollectionsResource] [Table handle exploit] Can attackers manipulate collection_data and token_data Table handles to access or modify other users' NFT data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collections.rs] [Field: collection_data] [Cross-collection attack] Can attackers use one collection's Table handle to access data from different collections? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collections.rs] [Field: mint_token_events] [Mint event forgery] Can attackers emit fake mint events without actually creating tokens to inflate perceived collection size? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/collections.rs] [Field: token_data] [Token data corruption] Can concurrent modifications to token_data Table cause race conditions leading to token data corruption? (High)
